metadata.title: How to Create a YouTube Channel Trailer 2025: Complete Guide
metadata.description: Create an effective channel trailer that converts visitors to subscribers. Structure, tips, and examples that work.

hero.headline: How to Create a YouTube Channel Trailer That Converts
hero.subheadline: Your 60-second pitch to new visitors. Make it count.

sections.content: Your channel trailer plays automatically for non-subscribers visiting your channel. It's your best chance to convert a curious visitor into a subscriber. The most effective trailers are short, clear about the channel's value, and give a taste of your personality and content.

content.title: Clear Value Proposition
content.description: What does your channel offer? Why should they subscribe? Answer in 10 seconds.

content.title: Content Showcase
content.description: Show clips of your best content. Let people see what they'll get.

content.title: Personal Connection
content.description: Show your personality. People subscribe to people, not just topics.

sections.title: Trailer Structure Template
content: Introduction (5-15s): Who you are and what you do

sections.title: Trailer Checklist
content: Set as channel trailer in settings

faq.question: How long should a channel trailer be?
faq.answer: 30-60 seconds is ideal. Maximum 90 seconds. Shorter trailers convert better. Say what you need to say efficiently.

faq.question: Should I script my trailer?
faq.answer: Yes. Every second matters in a trailer. Script tightly, practice delivery, and edit ruthlessly. Don't ramble.

faq.question: How often should I update my trailer?
faq.answer: When your content direction changes significantly or your trailer feels dated. Some creators update yearly, others keep the same trailer for years.

faq.question: Do channel trailers still matter?
faq.answer: Yes. Auto-play catches attention. Many subscribers credit the trailer for their subscription. It's free real estate on your channel page.
